inn1.comm: good line and length, angling across the left-hander, ignored by Strauss with a raise of the bat
full length, an open-faced drive, squeezes through point to get the innings up and running
nice start from Rankin, wide of the crease, hitting a good length and angling in at off stump. Defended
slightly offline, and a firm clip is well gathered at fine leg to save the boundary
striding forward, but not quite there for the drive. Rankin fields in his followthrough
that's a cracking shot, KP was walking across his stumps before the ball was released, and he used the natural angle to lever a ball from outside off through midwicket, all along the ground. Classy
standing tall on the back foot, pushed into the covers
a birthday bonus for Strauss, on the toes and milked into the legside. He worked the gaps so well against India
back outside off stump this time, left alone
full length but enough width to have a go, Strauss chops a cut into the gully and scampers through
dabbed out to cover, and KP does the scampering this time
solid line and length, a heavy ball outside off stump, and the end of a mostly tidy over
well, that was a thick inside-edge from a pushed drive, but it whistles through square leg. Top edging!
that's no edge, that's a stunningly full-faced drive. He didn't try to hit it too hard, he just chose his gap, a millimetre to the side of the non-striker's stumps, and no-one could stop it
across his stumps, and blocked
good line and length, KP bides his time
worked off the hip to keep the strike rotating. Comfortable start for England's openers
again, Strauss's eye for the bread-and-butter run is faultless. Slightly leg-sided, and flicked effortlessly into the gap at midwicket
outside off, no stroke offered
tighter line, KP tries to work the single into the leg-side, but gets into a slight tangle. No great alarm
watchful work from Strauss, treating each ball on its merits
too much width, and the skipper has a thrash. No control on the shot, but none needed. He went hard, and third man couldn't cut that off
outside off, attempts the dab, but doesn't get enough on it
angled into the pads, and nudged to midwicket
attempted nurdle into the leg side, can't find the gap on this occasion
big stride outside off, but the ball was too wide to take on comfortably
a push and go into the off side. Easy
bouncer, decent delivery with good carry. Strauss sways

Strauss goes for the pull, a spiralling top-edge, Dockrell at fine leg looked for all money like taking the chance, but the ball had enough legs to plop over the boundary! Lucky for the skipper, not quite as emphatic as his six off Yuvraj!
KP walks across his stumps again, but is in control of the flick through square leg
big stride, pushed into the covers
unexpected aggro from Strauss! Down the track and a dirty great hack into the leg-side. That could have gone anywhere, but ended up at midwicket
forward and defended to mid-on
attempted swish through midwicket, sharply fielded and KP is kept under wraps by a threatened shy
a good over spoiled by a bad ball to finish. On the toes, firmly clipped. Four all the way
on the pads from Rankin this time, clipped hard to deep square leg, and they jog a couple
cracking square drive, but straight to the fielder. Good relay throw from Joyce to ensure no cheeky singles
Strauss rocks back to pull, a touch frenetically. And doesn't time it
down the leg-side, not by much, but enough

a bludgeoning drive into the covers, and Kevin O'Brien looks in big trouble here. He stopped the initial drive, went to collect the rebound, and his knee clicked in completely the wrong direction as his foot slid. Let's hope it looked worse than it actually was. Happily, he's back on his feet now. A solid unit
whizzing down the leg side
pushed out to cover
on the pads, flicked hard to midwicket
worked off the pads for a single
a push and go from Strauss, mid-off was set back, and his instant call worked a treat
patted back down the track. Good length again
on the pads, flicked but intercepted by short backward square. A let-off
shovelled into the leg side, another well-selected single
an imperceptible shuffle at the crease, but KP's extra room doesn't result in a booming drive through the covers. Merely a nudge to point
that's a cute shot from Strauss. The keeper was standing up, the slips were absent, so a delicate deflection races for four through third man
on the pads, worked out to square leg
driven to mid-off, but too well timed and KP wisely opts against a red bull run
floated up, a touch too full, and Pietersen drills this on the up, through the gap, and away to the cover boundary
tucked off the toes, a scamper to mid-on
a misjudgement from Strauss, and that drops inches short of short midwicket. A late indecision - should he pull or shouldn't it - nearly costs the skipper!
tight line and length on off stump. Solidly  blocked
a pie-chart states that ninety percent of KP's tournament runs have come in the arc from cover to backward square, and here's a shot to boost that percentage, a booming drive over long-on for six!
nudged into the covers
Strauss had to scamper as KP flicks to deep midwicket, he'd have been gone if the shy had hit, but it didn't
another flick to midwicket
a steady steer for a single to third man. That's the end of the Powerplay
bustling start from Cusack to the new over, his ODI bowling average is excellent, by the way. Strauss laces a drive but picks out cover. He's done that a lot today
swing and miss outside off. Strauss advancing down the wicket and swishing at fresh air
this time Strauss finds bat on ball, though not very much bat and it squirts off the outside edge down to third man
good line from Cusack, tight on off stump and Pietersen is rooted to the crease in defence
again the line is tight and nowhere for Pietersen to do
ah, a good over gets ruined thanks to a slight err in line. Who'd be a bowler? Angling onto leg stump and Pietersen flicks it airily  to the midwicket boundary
starts with flight, which is good to see, good line to - around middle. Strauss deep into his crease, dinking into the leg side
no width on offer and Pietersen hops back to squeeze a careful cut shot to deep point
oops, the line is wrong, shoved down the leg side. Strauss tried to wheel a pull shot but got nothing of it
tucked into the midwicket region
very respectful forward defence from Pietersen. Good flight and line from Dockrell
lovely shot this, really high quality. Skipped down the wicket to find a half-volley and flicked powerfully to bring up a rapid half-century. Looks in might good order
ooh, Pietersen aims a hard sweep, almost throwing himself off his feet in the process. Misses and it bobbles away off the pads
starts down the leg side, and flicked away as a result with Strauss scampering back for a second
just the slightest bit of width and Strauss dabs a delicate sing  to fine third man
very swift running earns a single to short third man despite a direct hit. Pietersen dabbed and Strauss called him through in a hurry
strained appeal from the bowler, but he didn't get much company as this thuds off Strauss's pads. It was heading down
good delivery this, back of a length, tight on off stump. Strauss would have to invent to find runs, he doesn't
very similar delivery and this time Strauss did try and work a single with a flick of the wrists, but too early on the ball and a leading edge causes a flutter of alarm

that's the delivery that Pietersen gets into trouble with against left-arm spinners. Skidding on with the angle, he looked to give himself room expecting turn before hurrying a jab down when it didn't come
Dockrell intent on preventing width but goes too far this time and spears down the leg side
Pietersen gets himself off strike by dinking a single

Dockrell strikes again! Strauss out for 34 on his 34th birthday. Dockrell maintained his line, Strauss jumped outside off to try and manufacture a shovel to leg, in the end he couldn't catch up with the ball and it went straight into his stumps
very straight and a touch of flight from Dockrell and careful defence from Trott
hint of edge here as Trott goes back to cut, runs harmlessly to short third man
Trott is away in classic Trott fashion, getting deep into his crease and flicking a single to deep midwicket
nicely done, Trott is actually a very efficient driver of the ball. Gets some width, and the right length and neatly punches a drive to the point boundary
too short from Mooney, too wide too. The pitch is coming on nicely so that's asking for trouble. Trott, with a minimum of fuss and a maximum of timing, cuts past a sprawling third man
worked square of the wicket, looks in fine order so far
wow, Pietersen gets all of this. Gone a mile! Just a touch too short, Pietersen was lunging forward but rocked back and dismissed it from his sight, swatting high into the stands over midwicket
this time it's defended, Mooney getting his length right
damaging over that, despite ending with a dot
good flight, good line too and Trott pops forward in defence
this time Trott hops back to try and work a single to the leg side, but Dockrell's length is too full
Trott repeats the shot and beats the infield to collect a couple to deep midwicket
rare sight of Trott edging down the track, only to defend though
again the line and length is impeccable, touch quicker and flatter this time, Trott prods to midwicket
very good over with Trott flowing a drive to deep cover. Dockrell is ridiculously composed, especially for a teenager. Smart chap too, apparently
starts flat and quick and around middle, prodded into the leg side
outside off stump this time and Trott happy to get his eye in against the new bowler
after two dots  Trott is comfortable to work a single to point
beaten! Outside off stump, touch of flight, drift even and Pietersen lunged across to defend but it slid past the edge
Pietersen a bit twitchy here in defence against Stirling

would you believe it? I guess you would have to. Ridiculous end to promising innings. Having faced two deliveries from Stirling, and played neither well, Pietersen aims a cute, reverse-dab. Manages a top edge that loops up for O'Brien to gobble behind the stumps
Trott leans a drive to cover
ah lovely shot, Trott flicking hard off his legs down to deep midwicket where Wilson slides along the boundary to save the extra run
Bell calmly forward in defence
some flight from Dockrell draws Bell out of his crease, some dip draws an inside edge and it runs to mid-on. Lovely bowling
Bell is back in his crease this time to pick out cover with a drive. The throw whips in from the fielder and O'Brien is in full voice. Good hustle from the Irish
fuller and flighted outside off, Bell punches to cover again
Trott working the singles with ease it seems. Sits on the back foot, soft-hand prods to cover and skips through for one
huge cheer from O'Brien as a sliding stop from short midwicket stops Bell collecting a single
this time Bell beats the man to milk to long-on
another smooth shot from Trott, waiting on the back foot to find a gap wide of short cover and glide a couple
driven harder this time, but straight to mid-off
Trott on the back foot this time to bunt to mid-on. Decent mini-period for Ireland
angled in from wide of the crease, back of a length and Bell steers to point
very similar delivery but this time Bell is up on his toes to punch a single down the ground
fuller this time, something near a yorker. Squirted to point
lovely drive again from Trott, picking a gap wide of deep cover to saunter a couple
this time it's worked square of the wicket. Trott very busy after missing out against India
Bell stands tall to defend to point
good length from Stirling, outside off stump, punched off the back foot
attempted drive, a bit of a leading edge
now Bell's in on the reverse-sweeping act! Another muffed shot
driven, and missed! Top bowling from Stirling, right on the money, as a colleague has just wittered (as opposed to Twittered)
Trott works the gap
clunked down to long-on, a single to end a tidy over
on the toes, a touch too full, flicked down to fine leg
driven hard, back to the bowler, who fields well - low, in his followthrough
flicked off the toes out to midwicket
firm drive, full face of the bat. Another single to long-off
singles, singles everywhere. Calm accumulation for now
quicker delivery, rising onto the toes to punch into the covers. Good over
worked out to point
a dab to wide mid-on. Solid work from Stirling, really nailing his length on off stump, with a hint of grip off the pitch
that's unlucky, nothing wrong at all with the ball, perfect length, Trott played for non-existent turn, found a fat edge, and it's the first boundary for seven overs
plugging that good length again, nudged out to cover
good flight, worked to leg
a bit more width, met with an uppish steer to deep point. Thoughts about a second but the fielder swoops well
attacking delivery, full and targeting the stumps. Chopped down to third man with a late adjustment
hard drive, back to the bowler, who parries
out to cover with a punch off the back foot
chaos! A flick off the toes, Bell wanted two all along, Trott was dallying, but the throw came to the wrong end, O'Brien relayed, but the chance was gone
outside off, and O'Brien whips off the bails for good measure
punched drive to cover, to keep the strike
top work again, really probing that line on off stump
tossed right up, Bell drives hard, but cover intercepts beautifully
cramped for room by another well-flighted delivery on the stumps
a jab to point, and a relieved single
that reverse sweep again! The third England batsman to attempt it against Stirling, and yet again, he makes a total hash of it
the best shot of the over, a well timed clip through midwicket. But more sharp fielding cuts off the runs. An excellent over
tucked off the toes, another single to deep backward square
open-faced glide through third man
quality strike to bring up the 150. A fraction over-pitched, a full flow of the bat, and the Sledgehammer puts this one over the infield, one bounce over long-on
off the strike with a dab. Sensible batting, as the cliche goes
forward and defended back down the track
milked off the toes, through midwicket for another single. A better over from England's run-rate point of view
top strike once again, slightly too full, Trott advances and flicks up and over midwicket
driven out to cover
a jabbed push to point, Trott thinks of a single, but thinks again
open-faced drive, and an excellent interception in the gully, diving one-handed to the right
flicked out to deep midwicket
Trott keeps the strike. He's now very very close indeed to a new record for fastest to 1000 runs - another 21, and Sir Viv (and KP) are history ...
down the track, but Dockrell's flight is too flighty. Bell can't get to the pitch properly
stays back in the crease this time, and nurdles into the legside
solid block, bat and pad tight together on line of middle and leg
back of a length, cut firmly to cover, but so little pace on the ball
teasing work, subtle variations on every delivery. Five men up in the circle to keep the pressure on
a calm sweep to keep the strike, but another wonderfully cool over
blocked out to point
wristy flick, but mid-on is equal to the shot, and forces Bell to scurry back to the crease
turned to leg, but can't pierce the field
a fraction shorter, and driven on the up to point
a rare loose delivery, a low full-toss, punched out to deep cover
an unsubtle drive, back to the bowler. The spinners are keeping Ireland in the game
a touch of room to work the gap, as Dockrell drops an inch short and Bell steps back and across for a flick to midwicket
six men in the circle but Trott finds the single
the Sledgehammer breaks the ice! Down the track, a beautifully timed lofted drive, over the ropes at long-off!
on the pads, turned down the leg-side
nudged out to square leg
on the pads, tucked square
Bell keeps the strike rotating
that one skidded through a touch low. Bell adjusts late, with a look of surprise
worked into the leg side
a fraction short of a length, punched on the up
flicked to the leg-side, but that's another fine over

ooh, almost all over for Bell as he eased down the wicket to try and chip over long-on, got more edge than middle and Joyce hared in but could only get it on the half-volley, it slipped through him and bobbled away to the rope
after that alarm Bell reverts to careful defence
more flight from Dockrell, more defence from Bell
touch shorter and Bell gets deep into his crease to clip to leg
Dockrell gets his line wrong and onto the pads, Trott flicks two more very efficiently
fifty for Trott! Run machine. Sweeps hard and fine of deep square, typically unfussy and effective innings
Stirling is doing a fine job and Bell can only defend
the line drifts a touch to leg and Bell picks off a single
Trott happy to pick off the singles against Stirling, staying deep in his crease to work to leg
Bell advances down the track and skews a drive square of the wicket on the off side. He was aiming straighter
better timing this time, for a very middle-overs single down the ground
annoying for Stirling. Nothing wrong with the delivery, it was very full but squeezed off an outside edge and hurried away to the third man boundary
starts well, landing back of a length around off stump. Bell on his toes to defend
Bell cascades down the track, more fidgety than menacing, only to defend
touch short and Bell wheels a pull shot. Timing it very nicely to beat midwicket. Rankin continues to leak runs this tournament
better ball, hitting a length and Bell is forced back to defend
even fuller this time, straighter too, and meets a full and straight bat
touch harsh this from the umpire. Especially given the pitch is dreamy for batting. It was wide of off and Trott missed a cut shot, only to be reprieved by the umpire
straighter, a little too straight and Trott fiddles around the corner
Trott glides a shortish ball backwards of point
fuller ball, Bell threads down the ground
driven to cover, no great intent
Trott skips down the wicket and fiddles into the leg side
shorter ball that Bell spoons wide of long-on to bring up his second successive half-century
workmanlike over, full of singles and doubles, ends with Bell chipping another single to the midwicket region
Bell chops his first delivery down to third man. Touch too much pace in the wicket for Johnston to be at his most effective
tight line and length and Trott can do nothing with it
the line drifts a touch towards the legs and Trott happily flicks with the angle
fuller and Bell steps out to push a drive to long-off
good work from Johnston, maintaining his discipline and Trott finds mid-off
Johnston runs his fingers over the ball and it slips out as a gentle beamer, Trott glides a single and the bowler apologises
and Trott greets him with a whip to leg to equal the record for the quickest to 1000 ODI runs, just 21 innings! Good company as well, Viv Richards and Kevin Pietersen.  Well done him
forward and careful in defence
and again Trott clips into the leg side, so straightforward
Bell this time works off his toes to jog a single
Trott nudges a single to midwicket. But you already knew that
ah, lovely Bell batting. Flowing, fluid cover drive that speeds to the rope
Johnston as accurate as ever and Trott as efficient as ever, opening the face to pinch a single to point
Bell uses the width on offer to dink a cut shot to third man. England really coasting at the moment
fuller and wider, invites a flash from Trott that speeds out to deep point
oh, if he failed Bell would have been criticised. But he didn't. Jumps outside off stump, gets down on one knee and dabs this just over short fine leg for four
after all that modern business, Bell reaches for the textbook and drives beautifully down the ground
touch shorter to Trott and he has to stand tall to cut carefully out on the off side
Dockrell to bowl it and Trott does indeed play normally, fiddling a single to the leg side
Dockrell giving Bell no width so it's instead tickled to fine leg
this is speared down leg, no much flight on that
another leg-side whip from Trott, good work from Dockrell so far
Bell so far has done nothing at all rash in the Powerplay, instead happy to work a single to leg
smart fielding at short midwicket saves a single
with the field up on the off side Dockrell can't give width, that means though that the line goes wrong occasionally. Like here as Dockrell fires a long way down the leg side
despite the wides this is a good over that ends with Bell working a single to the leg side
good tight line from Cusack, again Bell can only work into the leg side
oh no! In his desperation to prevent width Cusack has fired this down leg and left O'Brien no chance standing up to the stumps
this is wide of off and almost punished as Trott threads a cut into space, but a diving, sprawling stop from Dockrell saves a certain boundary. Good work, limbs all over the place from him
Bell leaning back at defending to cover
Bell very content to pick off singles into space. Driving down the ground
wow! That was odd. Looked like Trott mistimed this and played too early on a back-foot punch. But it flew past mid-on and raced to the boundary
he definitely timed this! Forward and flowing into a drive, races past mid-off
forward and driven into the covers. This could and should be a massive score. Well, massive by England's usual middling standards of massiveness
short and pulled into the leg-side
poor ball from Dockrell, he's not quite been the same since Bell lofted him for six. Wide all the way down the leg-side
worked into the leg-side for another single
back into the crease and punched into the covers
worked into the leg-side
another nudge to the leg-side
a crunching drive, on the up, but well intercepted at cover
driven, in the air, not at all timed as the bat twists on the point of impact, but cover can't scamper back in time. A let-off
driven into the covers again
dobbled onto a good length, met with a firm drive to long-off
well that's just a bit cheeky. Bell dances all over the shop, Johnston responds with a low full-bunger, and Bell shimmied inside the line to sweep up and over fine leg. Top shot!
a more ordinary stroke to finish the over, Centuries there for the taking today ...
forward and defended to mid-off
wide on the crease, Trott uses the angle to farm a single to long-on
there was width on offer,  but a sharp piece of work in the gully saves a certain four. That was sweetly timed
into position for the pull, but doesn't quite middle it
driven down the ground, another single
Bell falls! Wide on the crease, an attempted yorker turns into a full toss, Bell's clip is thoroughly middled, but Stirling at midwicket plucks a blinder low to his right!
can't argue with that. Shortish delivery, leaping into the splice. Soft hands to guide the boundary through fine third man
Rankin responds with a leg-side wide. He and Anderson are being expensive
works the single to get Collingwood on strike
off the mark straightaway with a push into the covers
on the pads, flicked through square leg. Trott ticks along
down the track, a shovel to mid-on, and Colly has to scamper to make his ground. That would have been out if it had hit
on the pads again, worked down the leg-side
a thumping pull, but straight to midwicket
outside off, slightly short of a length so Trott has to wait for it to arrive, and as a result his timing is off
stand and deliver! A flat-footed smack down the ground, but instead of a six over long-off, Trott loses his off stump!
zoinks, that was close. Beaten first-up, outside off on the drive
an ugly smear across the line from Collingwood, not dissimilar to the shot that bowled him against India. But Zaheer is a touch more rapid ...
attempted yorker, and smacked through long-on. Shot
one more to the cause, off target from Johnston
patted out to point and an easy single
another reverse sweep, and it's the best executed of the four batsmen to attempt it, though that isn't saying much
bunted down the ground again, just short of the fielder. This pair are making runs look tough to come by
clipped hard to deep midwicket
that was always coming. Prior's eye for a gap has deserted him, as he retreats to square leg in a bid to carve through the covers, but he's made too much room
chopped through third man, literally, as the fielder fumbles. And that's the seventh 300 of the tournament
two more to the total as Mooney roars with frustration
that's better from Collingwood! Too full from Mooney, in the slot, and pummelled over the leg-side, onto the roof of the stand
low full-toss, and Collingwood might have expected to launch that over midwicket for six. Instead he's rolled it along the ground to the sweeper
good yorker, and a good run too, as Collingwood sprints for a single as the ball bobbles into the crease. I say good, but it would have been out if Mooney's boot had been on target
way outside off, no reaching that
an inconclusive performance from Collingwood. Another swipe down the ground, but it was badly sliced, and mid-on made no mistake
full length, jabbed down in the crease, and they rush through
that was in Bresnan's slot, but his slap down the ground finds only thin air
smeared into the covers, no-one's nearby to claim the catch
gives room, and misses. This innings is flatlining a touch. Which probably won't matter today, but will in future contests
another good delivery, swinging away, and beating Yardy's thrashed cut/drive
whisked out to deep point. Yardy likes to use the bowler's pace and keep the ball behind square, but the field is well set to him
dropped! Banged in short from round the wicket, Yardy didn't get hold of the pull and Wilson at deep midwicket stooped low, but not far enough forward!
thrashed cover-drive, hits the field
good delivery, slower ball, pinpoint accuracy, Yardy loses the top of his middle stump as he climbs into a cut and misses everything
good delivery again, on off stump, and nurdled out to point
well bowled again, but England's batsmen have resorted to hopeless thrashes and slogs since the end of the Trott and Bell stand. Outside off, and through to the keeper
slower ball again, and Bresnan shrugs as if to say he didn't pick it. Which would appear to be true
jabbed out to point with an open face
slogged to long-on, another good delivery in the circumstances
smacked up and over deep point. Still a shortage of boundaries for England
that's better from Swann, a half-volley in the shot for a big swing, one bounce down the ground
so much for that theory, in the slot, and deflected for a single
swirling, spiralling, steepling slog, into the leg-side, midwicket steadies himself well, sprints in, steps back, and snaffles a tough chance to finish the innings on a high

inn2.comm: ideal start for Anderson! Not a great delivery, full and wide outside off, but Porterfield dragged on to middle. Gut-wrenching for him and the Irish but just the spark Anderson needed
Anderson is straight this time, which is a relief for him. Joyce calmly nudges into the leg side
swing and a miss outside off stump. Full from Anderson, not much movement in the air
Joyce away, Ireland away. Smooth drive without a world of timing to extra cover
decent line to a left hander, but not to Stirling
hint of movement away from the bat this time, Stirling flags it through to Prior
beaten! That's the best delivery of the over. Aimed full and seaming away past the dangling outside edge
finally Broad bowls, and bowls well. Full, around off stump, good pace too. Joyce leans into a drive
ah, decides to keep his loosener for the second delivery, spearing well down the leg side

ooh, big shout from England. The bowler wants a review and the captain... has been talked into it! Replays confirm the umpire's decision. It pitched a long way outside leg stump and struck Joyce on the pad as he tries to nudged to leg. Wasted review
back of a length again and enough width for Joyce to steer - with a hint of thickish edge - to third man
nicely played here. Full face of the bat pushing to mid-off
good signs for Stirling. Up on one knee and swivelling a perfectly-timed pull shot, sailed away over the ropes
the response from the bowler is smart - on a length at off stump. Solidly blocked back to the bowler
very good-looking drive from Joyce straight back down the ground. Anderson shoved down a hand to take the pace off
flat-footed drive. Not a great shot just throwing his hands at the ball outside off and it skewed off the inside edge
tighter delivery and a tighter shot. Anderson as straight as Joyce's bat
Anderson happy to hold his length back, not searching for swing, Joyce compact in defence
back of a length again but the line is good. Joyce defends
maiden over for Anderson, that has been a rare, rare commodity for him in one-day cricket
Stirling wanted to go straighter than this but the thickish inside edge will do the job. Full and a touch leg-sided from Broad, Stirling cleared his front leg and swung through the line
edged again this time, outside edge and it flies down to third man
Joyce calmly sits on the back foot to steer to third man
better delivery from Broad, hitting a fullish length on off stump. Stirling is respectful in response
again Broad sets the controls to the hear of off stump, Stirling confidently forward in defence
that's a cracker, just a hint shorter and Stirling rocks back and whips a pull-jab shot away backwards of square. Timed it perfectly
Anderson is lucky Joyce didn't get more of this. Slipped down the leg side and just needed to be helped on its way but Joyce fluffed it
oh dear, poor shot. First delivery Stirling has faced against Anderson and he's had a flat-footed hoik at fresh air
better here, more compact and treating a good Anderson delivery with the respect it probably deserved
this one was there to hit and Stirling aimed a pick-up smash into the leg side. Unfortunately for him he missed it, no real reason why either
very fluid drive, touch uppish but Joyce's timing and style is good and it races past Strauss at short extra cover
good response from Anderson, touch fuller and it nipped back off the seam and sliced Joyce in two. Anderson aimed a stare but Joyce wasn't interested
Broad spears in a yorker, which England don't do much of, Stirling jabs down on it
Stirling advances down the pitch but ends up yorking himself and has to stab out to cover in a rush
good slower ball here, smart thinking with the way Stirling was advancing. The batsman's response was good, steering with soft hands into the covers
Joyce seems to move in slow motion, added to his left-handedness it makes him a good player to watch. Even when he's just dabbing to third man

Broad attempts another slower ball and almost got the better of Stirling but at the last minute he held back, and fetched from outside off stump, swinging across the line to drag it to the long-on boundary
driven hard this time, but straight to cover
this is a dreadful pitch, absolutely nothing there for the bowlers. Joyce opens the face, times it perfectly and glides to the cover boundary
this time Anderson is straighter and Joyce can do nothing but defend
enough width again for Joyce to run down to third man
Anderson's line is wrong again. Shoved down the leg side and even though Stirling missed his tickle, a flick of the thigh pad took it out of Prior's reach
once again the line is wrong but a slower ball this time finds more pad and bobbles square
super Strauss dives to field smartly at short extra. Somebody give him a knighthood
as ever, Bresnan fires down on a length and line, heading to the top of off as Stirling defends
nothing fancy from Bresnan, just holding a line around off stump and almost catches Joyce fishing
drags the length back this time Joyce blocks under his eyes
fuller this time but the line remains impeccable. Joyce defends
this time the hint of drift to the leg side means Joyce can nudge a single to midwicket
Stirling advances, but Bresnan is rock solid, dragging his length back in response. The shot ends up being a rash slap with no timing to mid-on
angled in from that low-arm and Stirling picks off a single to deep midwicket
touch of air from Yardy and Joyce quietly pushes to the off side
solidly pushed out to long-on
Joyce skips down  the wicket and flicks down the ground
solid defence from Stirling. And from Yardy, really
a fraction short and a fraction wide, Stirling hung leg side of the ball, leant back and thwacked through cover for four. He looked remarkably like Darren Gough there
too much width, never ends well for the bowler. Joyce dispatched it with a flash of the hands, very neatly done
better feet from Joyce here in defence. Got back and across and played under his eyes
again very compact from Joyce as he opens the face to glide to third man

lovely shot, there has been plenty of bluster and power from Stirling but here was a flick of the wrists. Waiting on a slower ball to turn his wrists over it, send  it fine of short fine leg and pick up the boundary

ah, sad end for Stirling. Banged just back of a length from Bresnan around off stump and Stirling aimed a slug to leg. Only managed a top edge that sailed high and swirled over Pietersen, who watched it carefully at deep square to snaffle the chance. Bresnan the man again for England
banged in again, extra bounce this time gives Joyce the hurry up
forward and defended on a good length
round the wicket again, rocks back to cut, but doesn't time it
tossed up into the blockhole, squirted out to square leg
fully forward, defended into the covers
pushed back to the bowler, no width to work with
excellent exploratory first over, no freebies whatsoever
good delivery, leaving the left-hander with a  bit of bounce
squeezed down to third man with an open-faced push
on the pads, angling across the stumps, nudged to midwicket with a leap
short ball from Bresnan, a floundering pull shot,  but three men converged at short mid-on, but no-one could get there
dropped! Another mow across the line, a massive steepler, Prior turned round in circles to try to steady himself as the ball plummeted out of the night sky, but couldn't cling on!
and a measured defence to end a frenetic over. Bressie is making things happen again!
still round the wicket, on a good length
onto the pads, pushed to midwicket
drawn forward, defended back to the bowler
whoops, that didn't go where intended! A chinese cut to fine leg
chopped into the off side, Swann is finding good flight and pace on the ball
on the legs again, but the angle doesn't give much to work with. Another tidy over
pressing forward, defended to cover
hits the deck hard, and flicked out to point via a combination of edge and pad-flap. In fact, it was just pad-flap
short and aggressive. O'Brien swings into a pull, but that's beaten him
firmly jabbed to cover
on the pads, and swung hard to fine leg, who fields on the bounce
back and across and defended back down the track
fenced back to the bowler
down on the sweep, but can't middle it
attempted cut, but not timed
twirled into the blockhole, and driven comfortably down to long-off
worked off the pads

dropped! Anderson's bowling has been back on song, but his brilliant fielding standards remain in the doldrums! A flat drive to long-off, he was back on the rope, but the ball burst through his fingers!
on the hip, nudged for a single
good heavy ball from Bresnan, hits the splice hard, with scarcely a hair's breadth  to operate within
more aggressive back-of-a-length bowling. It's serving a good purpose so far
short again, but this time O'Brien was waiting for the delivery, and slotted it in front of square. Top shot
overcompensation from Bresnan, and he pays the price, outside off
an average delivery from Bresnan, and that's reignited Ireland's hopes. Short and leg-sided, and helped around the corner
better line and length, hopping through to the keeper
down the leg side
on the pads again, punched off the back foot to long-on
tossed right up, and over-tossed in fact. A full toss is punched straight to cover. A let-off
good use of the feet to work another single to long-off
short, and calmly pulled out to long-on
quicker delivery, skids through to be cut out to deep point, and that's going to be drinks
another single to reboot the chase, as Colly's cutters enter the fray
round the wicket, good length, defended
blocked out to cover, no run on offer there
hitting a good length with a threat of movement. Punched to cover
attempted nurdle, a deflection clangs off the face of the bat, and the helmet. Lucky his head got in the way really!
defended again, Decent first over
round the wicket is the way to go with two lefties in. On a good length again
chiselled up to mid-on
crashing drive to the sweeper at deep cover
into position for the sweep, not quite timed, but one more to the total nonetheless. It's all they really need for now
punched out to the deep. The steady flow of singles continues
right on the spot, defended with a full face to cover
O'Brien picks the gap well, just enough room to work with
down on one knee for a premeditated sweep, places it well as fine leg rushes round to save the boundary
low full toss, punched into the covers
another full toss, lapped to fine leg. Not the best use of the facilities, as they say. Mind you, it is a flat deck
better line and length, Collingwood yelps an appeal, but that was middle of the bat
good finish to the over, a bit of nip off the seam, and defended awkwardly
driven calmly and quietly to long-on
whoops, that's the nut. Full length, slips under an extravagant sweep slog, and back goes the off stump!
bit of air from Swann aiming for off stump. Finds solid defence
touch of extra bounce takes this past the outside edge
some spin here, slower from Swann and it grips off the pitch, turning past an attempted flick to leg
this hops from a length, the batsman hops with it and Wilson defends
stroked down the ground for a gimme single
solid forward block into the off side
another one down! Tough drop, would have been a good one. Popped back towards the bowler, Collingwood dived across but couldn't hold on
bunted to third man securely this time
careful defence from Joyce
Joyce aims a drive but no pace on the ball and ends up inside edging back to the bowler
soft hands pops this to point where swift running allows Joyce back on strike

beauty from Swann does for Joyce. No mistake from Prior this time. Joyce skips down the track, bit of drop from Swann and sharp spin takes it past the outside edge, Prior has a single bail off in a flash. Swann is delighted, as well he might be
this is a Freddie-esque hard-handed block
booming drive aimed, not landed but the outside edge takes it past a vacant slip area to the third man rope
back to defence this time, Swann has relocated his zing after a pasting the other night
touch of air, touch of spin, plenty of worry for O'Brien
round arm, no much spin, plenty of angle. Slid off the face in defence
defended firmly into the off side
stroked back to Yardy who fields and turns in one movement
Wilson advances and squeezes this to short fine leg. He hasn't look in particularly good order so far
touch shorter and nudged to midwicket off the back foot
O'Brien manages to find what little spin there was to end up with a leading edge to mid-off
Strauss is up at slip and Swann is beating the outside edge here

Wilson's torturous effort ends. Or does it? Review after Swann finds the pads as Wilson stretches forward to sweep. The only danger was the 2.5 metre stuff, but it's plumb. Not a very happy return for Wilson
that's a decent start! Cusack swishing a drive through the line past a diving cover
careful defence from the front foot
poor shot this, Cusack was pinned to the crease and just aimed a waft, no intent
much better this time, Cusack down the track and driving firmly to mid-off
O'Brien leans this down the ground
this keeps a little low and it toe-ended out to deep point
too short from Yardy, never going to end well. O'Brien hung back and slugged to the deep midwicket fence
the batsman tries to give himself room but Yardy follows him, cramping any big shot intended
gets all of this! Giving himself a touch of room again and O'Brien thwacked a hard drive through extra cover
for no apparent reason O'Brien misses a fiddle to leg
Cusack struggling here, mistiming an airy drive one-bounce to mid-off
quicker, flatter ball is trickled around the corner
hint of extra bounce gets Prior excited, but Cusack actually stroked this quite confidently to deep point
front foot plonked down and O'Brien heaves his enormous arms across the line to send it into the midwicket stands. Makes him the highest runscorer for Ireland in ODI cricket
celebrates the landmark with careful defence
and again! If Sachin can do it, why can't Kevin!? Same idea, front foot down the wicket, solid base and heave to leg. Goes flat and crashes into the fence
decent start to a new spell, back of a length and straight. Blocked uncertainly
Cusack sits on the back foot, opens the face and nudges down to third man
wider from Broad, too loose really, Cusack chops fine down to third man and it's only a tumbling save from the wonder that is Trott that saves the boundary
this is much better, full, touch of drift into the batsman, dug out
sloppy and shoddy. Broad overcooks a yorker, firing down the leg side, Prior doesn't manage to save and it runs away
really shades of Flintoff here again. Too short and a touch too wide, there is plenty of O'Brien so he only needs to get a bit of the ball for it to speed away to the point boundary
down the leg side this time and Broad is lucky it only bobbled off the pads
much quicker this time, comes off a flurry of bat and arms and pad into the leg side
Cusack stands up and punches a single down the ground to bring O'Brien back. Will he go again?
not here. Very quick and flat from Swann, O'Brien punches back to the bowler
O'Brien has England rattled here. He jumps outside leg to give himself room, Swann followed with a dart and the batsman flipped it around the corner past short fine leg
this is driven out to the off side
Swann's work is done, good work it was too, finishes with three wickets to make up for his pounding the other night. Ends the spell with Cusack driving to mid-off
back of a length from Broad, tight line too and O'Brien bunts into the covers
fuller this time, Cusack very still just swings a drive to mid-off

Broad isn't happy, he wanted Prior to have a go at this perhaps. It was short though, touch wide too and cut, with some outside edge, airily through a vacant slip to bring up a 50-run stand from 31 balls
Cusack finds his range now! Floated up a touch full from Broad and it was thrashed through the covers
much better from Broad. Hits a length, zips it away off the seam and past an outside edge
follows a good ball with a bad one and it's cut away again
a bit of width, goes for the cut but can't time it
tapped into the covers
that one tailed in nicely, met with a full face but definite hints of reverse
another inswinger, a big appeal but always going down leg. Encouraging signs though
worked off the pads, more signs of swing
thoughts of a single, and Cusack nearly slipped as the chance was turned down
twirled onto a good length, nudged fine
that's a filthy delivery. Prior makes excellent ground to save five wides
aiming down the leg-side from round the wicket again. Nurdled to short fine leg
more valuable runs, thought there was an inside-edge. Apparently not, but it goes very fine and no-one can cut it off!
a flat-batted bosh from deep in the crease
more poor bowling allied to excellent hitting, and that's swept superbly through fine leg
an appalling over comes to a cracking end for O'Brien, another bullish sweep, and beautifully timed behind square!
great delivery, fizzing late reverse swing, and a flat-footed push outside off. Just misses the edge
back of a length, poked in front of square on the leg side from the back foot. Another single to the cause
makes room for a mow, but the ball was too good to be collared

excellent stroke in the circumstances. Getting right behind another inswinging delivery, and a firm bunt up and over the bowler's head. Strauss dives well to field, and makes a point about England's flagging standards
battered! Too short from Anderson, O'Brien was onto it in an instant, and that's a 30-ball fifty! Top tonking that Irishman! The fastest in their ODI history...
a dot ball to end a breathless over. England need to get a grip here, or it's going to get awkwardly tight
outside off, carved out to point
Cusack finds the single to get the main man on strike. Good batting
short, and swished, and that's another boundary! Didn't go where it was intended, but who cares! Third man can't intercept
in the blockhole, the right delivery for the situation, but O'Brien gets good bat on it to dig out a single to long-on
short, and nudged down to third man
jeepers, now that's a strike! Nothing much wrong with the ball, but that has been utterly battered over extra cover for six! Gave himself a fraction of room, and absolutely savaged the delivery!
short, and spanked over cover. Cusack is middling the ball as well now
clever play, working the single to cover
everywhere you look, it's a boundary! Another inside-edge, this time through fine leg. But it doesn't matter. That's a 61-ball century stand. Sixty-one!
bosh! Fetch that! A half-volley, drilled to the cover boundary, and O'Brien holds the pose for the snappers!
shorter ball, whizzes through. A precious dot for England!
right, I think it is official, England are in big trouble now! Nothing they can do is going right. Another stand-and-deliver blow, flies out of the screws, way over midwicket!
round the wicket, still aiming at the pads .... gets away with this one
defended back down the track
walloped hard and straight, but Yardy stands firm and fields in his followthrough
worked out to square leg, loud shouts of "Bres, Bres, Bres!" as Bresnan fields. England are rattled
good delivery, dipping in towards the stumps, worked up to mid-on
wow. You can't say fairer than that. Crashed through the cover ring, and that is a 62-run Powerplay!
pushed onto the  back foot, fenced to third man
that looked like an excellent delivery, but it is belatedly called wide on height. England are not amused. But then, they haven't been all innings
strikes the pad, and rolls down to third man. A single is a victory now for England
cramped for room on off stump, that's well bowled. Respectfully played to cover
nips off the pitch and thoughts of a review, but that was going down leg
short, pulled, and another vital boundary! Where was Yardy though? If he'd been on the rope, that would have been out!
that is sensationally vast! England haven't got a prayer against hitting of this calibre. A fraction short, and he put his bat clean underneath it, high and mighty over midwicket!
punched out to point
worked down the ground to long-on, O'Brien is back on strike
uppishly pushed to point. This is good bowling so far, full but not too full
lifted to long-on, without extra power. A sense of relative calm has descended
good bowling from Collingwood, a teasing cutter outside off stump, patted into the covers
dropped! Is that the match? A massive steepler, O'Brien was right underneath it, Strauss rushed across at long-off, made a lot of ground, juggled the chance, and lost it as he hit the turf!
Yardy's line is leg and legger. This one shows too much leg
pushed to cover
a loud 'oi!' as the ball beats bat for once
battered down the ground, shouts of 'catch it!' but it drops well short of long-off
a swish across the line, no connection, but Prior can't gather either
dropped! Absolutely nothing is sticking! That was clobbered, but Yardy should have had it ...
driven down the ground. Wow. This is incredible. England are like a cork bobbing on the ocean of the World Cup, rising and falling to meet the quality of their opponents
Cusack has been the silent partner, but not anymore! The field is in for the second fiddle, so he batters his first six over midwicket!
good riposte from Collingwood, beaten outside off
another fine delivery, as Cusack is torn between attack and defence. Prior gathers
cool recovery of that lost ground. Outside off, beats the bat again. Three in three
whipped from off stump to square leg. O'Brien gets the strike for one ball of the over ...
thumped through long-on! Disrespectful boshing, and that's the 150 partnership! Collingwood bowled a fine over, but it's gone for 11!
Cusack has been superb, nudging, nurdling and giving the strike to O'Brien who is one blow away from a stunning ton
doesn't look to get it here, instead chips powerfully to swap the strike
ah lovely shot from Cusack! He's holding his nerve here, can England? Down the track and driving powerfully and it speeds away
follows up the boundary with a single, dinking one into space
solid forward defence. Pounding into the shot with his hard hands
that is the fastest hundred in World Cup history! Stunning innings, he roars to celebrate! Gets a full toss that he plonks into the leg side to scamper two
sharp pace, good line too. Cusack blocks into the off side
oh, so close! This shot looked a touch tired, nervy perhaps. Just flirted outside off it shot off the bottom edge past off stump. Those final five overs of England's innings really cost them...

heartbreak for Ireland! It's a run out that breaks the stand. O'Brien blocked hard to point, Cusack set off for one before turning back to save his partner. The throw came into Broad who under-armed onto the stumps to beat Cusack's dive. Brilliant example of a supportive innings from Cusack, just calmly gave O'Brien the strike and finished it by sacrificing himself
can Ireland hold their nerve, the closer they come the harder it will feel. This is pushed solidly to mid-on
good thinking from Broad, slower ball to Mooney, who calmly leans it through to midwicket
Mooney is away, but it means he'll keep the strike. Nudged square with the angle. Good sign for Ireland is that he looks calm
good start from Bresnan, banging back of a length at off stump. Dropped to point, Ireland want the single but the field is tight
nervy moments again with the running. Dropped to cover, Mooney hared off but had to be sent back
swing and a miss from Mooney, thudded off the body as O'Brien hurtled down for the single. An England fielder almost got in his way, wouldn't advise that
Bresnan not daring to go full, this is short of a good length and worked around the corner. The rate creeping back up now

buzzers! But it was a tight run that caused it! Mooney dropped it into the off side, O'Brien hurtled through again but needed an earth-shaking dive to make it. Bell aimed for the stumps, missed and they ran the overthrow
nervous defence this time. Mooney knows he needs to get his feet moving but the nerves are stopping him
some width again from Broad, it's what has caused all the trouble. O'Brien cleanly drives through cover and it's reached deep cover in a flash
Mooney is desperate to get rid of the strike, could spell run out trouble. This is dropped into the leg side but the fielders swarm in
outside edge! Precious outside edge does the job for Mooney, squirting down to third man

slower bouncer from Broad, outside off. O'Brien  waited on it, pulled solidly to deep midwicket and O'Brien had to rush back for the second. The harder he tried to run the slower he went though, looks knackered
Broad has just located his A-game here, another good slower ball around off stump. Bunted into the off side

England not happy! Broad tutting, Strauss looks to the skies. Nothing any of them could do with this, another golden outside edge for Mooney, flies wide of Prior and brings up a much-needed boundary. O'Brien will have the strike too!
O'Brien is annoyed with himself. Got a gift shortish on leg stump, just needed to help it away but missed and it bobbled down off the thigh. O'Brien crawled his single
Mooney is not trying anything expansive, which makes sense. But he doesn't look like turning the strike over either as he defends to point
top work from Bresnan, holding his nerve and his length and line. Mooney blocks again
short ball, zippy too. All of Bresnan's short balls have burst through the pull shots this innings. Through Mooney in a hurry and goes off the helmet wide of Prior, who dives to prevent runs
ooh, nothing fiddle outside off stump. Nervous swish and it's too pacey for Mooney
the Mooney outside edge works the magic again! Back of a length again from Bresnan, Mooney flashed at width and it flew to the third man boundary
good yorker here, full and very straight and O'Brien plays with the straightest of blades down the ground. Just a single though
that's what Mooney needs to do. Hangs back, threads through cover and brings the matchwinner back on strike
slower bouncer and O'Brien's pull shot is equally slow, carefully pushing it to deep midwicket. Looks like he's decided he has to be there at the end. He does
England buzz around Mooney as punches to cover. Good work from Broad this spell
oh dear, having just said that Broad has shoved this up in the slot. Mooney stood still and thrashed through the line, it screamed past cover. 300 up and suddenly the stadium is in full voice again
Broad is holding he knee, really hobbling and there wasn't much weight on this delivery. Full again and driven to the covers
ooh, holds this outside off stump. Mooney went fishing and couldn't connect
plenty of claps from the England captain for this. Bresnan holds his length back and Mooney punches to point

brilliant batting! Such clear thinking from Mooney. Rather then let the pressure build he has dart. Gives himself room expecting the shortish length again, Bresnan was indeed shortish and he flashed it over point for four
short again, flash and miss! It was far too quick for him and climbed over the top edge
whipped into the leg side this time. Mooney is flying here, just sat back and flipped it to backwards square. "Don't panic!" implores Prior. Too late, I reckon

excellent yorker from Bresnan, O'Brien manages to get the toe-end down just in time. Mooney called through for a single, having a race with Bresnan who ended up kicking the ball wide of the stumps for an overthrow!
starts leg side, Mooney flicks around the corner in the direction of Broad who is hobbling after it. Brings O'Brien back on strike, he's hardly had a hit of late
strong shot but O'Brien loses the strike again. Just 10 out of 38 balls he's faced in this stand. Fullish and driven firmly to long-off. Another long meeting for the England think tank
tight line from Anderson. Back of a length into the hip area and Mooney can't get it away
same line from the bowler, Mooney tries to give himself room but can't. Ends up gloving it and it loops agonisingly wide of the bowler before plopping into space
O'Brien takes another single, he's not tried anything expansive in a while. Mooney needs to finish this over with a bang

he does! Stunning work from Mooney. Delivering when he needs to. Clears his front leg, takes a punt and swings through the line. Absolutely nailed it to the midwicket fence. Ireland need a run a ball from the last 12. Should be a doddle!

oh dear! O'Brien has given it away! He's flat on his face and can't pick himself up. Run out, of all things and this match takes another turn. Yorker flipped to midwicket, he ran the single easily but wanted a second which didn't exist, despite a despairing dive. Ends one of the great World Cup innings, Ireland were buried before he turned it
no, not there Broad not there! Full toss,  gentle, and Johnston calmly got into line and drove sweetly to the extra cover rope. Incredible stuff
much better ball from Broad, much better. Back of a length and zipping through Johnston's defences
back of a length again and somehow Johnston has lumped this down the ground. He didn't want the two but Mooney forced him through for it. It was easy in the end and England are furious. 5 from 8...
that'll do, Broad leg side and Johnston flipping around the corner for a single. Brings the last-ball specialist Mooney on strike, he could finish it now
calm work from Mooney so calm. Keeps the strike by slicing down to deep point

Ireland have done it! Stunning chase! Mooney has his helmet off and screaming manically. It was full from Anderson and Mooney, cool as you like, just timed it wide of midwicket for four. The Irish players run out to the field, supporters are in tears! They have the highest run chase in World Cup history and have turned over their old enemy
